reason.tex:
%text \underline\text{Expected Value / Mean} The expected value of a random variable $(X)$ is defined as \[ \qquad\mu = E(X) = \sum_{i=1}^n p_i\cdot x_i\]
\underline\text{Variance} The variance of the random variable is defined as \[ \qquad \sigma^2 = \sum_{i=1}^n (x_i - \mu)^2\cdot p_i^2\]
With a little algebra, you can prove that \[ \sigma^2 = \left(\sum_{i=1}^n x_i^2\cdot p_i\right)- \mu^2 \]
\underline\text{Standard Deviation $(\sigma)$} As you would have guessed \[\qquad \sigma = \sqrt{\sigma^2} = \sqrt{\text{ Variance }}\] %
